elements.name: panel1
elements.title: Answer the questions on the text "Tenancy law".

elements.name: question1
elements.title: Name three obligations of the tenant.
elements.correctAnswer: The tenant must: pay the rent in advance, pay a rental deposit, report any defects to the landlord immediately.

elements.name: question2
elements.title: Name three obligations of the landlord or landlady.
elements.correctAnswer: The landlord or landlady must: hand over the property in a usable condition, submit a handover report, notify a rent increase in writing on a form approved by the canton in good time.

elements.name: question3
elements.title: What do you have to pay service charges for when renting an apartment? Give four examples.
elements.correctAnswer: Heating, building maintenance, sewage charges, general electricity

elements.name: panel2
elements.title: Answer the questions on the text "Tenancy law".

elements.name: question4
elements.title: What do you need to do before you sublet your apartment or part of it?
elements.correctAnswer: Inform the landlord in advance. The landlord may only refuse consent in exceptional cases if the subletting causes disadvantages.

elements.name: question5
elements.title: Explain the difference between the termination date and the notice period.
elements.correctAnswer: Period of notice: Period between receipt of the notice of termination and the end of the contract. The termination date is the day on which you move away.

elements.name: question6
elements.title: How can you defend yourself against the termination of your apartment or an unjustified rent increase?
elements.correctAnswer: Submit a request for rescission to the arbitration board within 30 days of receipt of the notice of termination.
